   20: -module(zip_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   25: 
   26: -export([borderline/1, atomic/1,
   27:          bad_zip/1, unzip_from_binary/1, unzip_to_binary/1,
   28:          zip_to_binary/1,
   29:          unzip_options/1, zip_options/1, list_dir_options/1, aliases/1,
   30:          zip_api/1, open_leak/1, unzip_jar/1,
   31: 	 unzip_traversal_exploit/1,
   32:          compress_control/1,
   33: 	 foldl/1,fd_leak/1,unicode/1,test_zip_dir/1,
   34:          explicit_file_info/1, mode/1,
   35:          zip64_central_headers/1, unzip64_central_headers/1,
   36:          zip64_central_directory/1,
   37:          basic_timestamp/1, extended_timestamp/1,
   38:          uid_gid/1]).
   39: 
   40: -export([zip/5, unzip/3]).
   41: 
   42: -import(proplists,[get_value/2, get_value/3]).
   43: 
   44: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   45: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   46: -include_lib("stdlib/include/zip.hrl").
   47: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   48: 
   49: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   50: 
   51: all() -> 
   52:     [borderline, atomic, bad_zip, unzip_from_binary,
   53:      unzip_to_binary, zip_to_binary, unzip_options,
   54:      zip_options, list_dir_options, aliases,
   55:      zip_api, open_leak, unzip_jar, compress_control, foldl,
   56:      unzip_traversal_exploit, fd_leak, unicode, test_zip_dir,
   57:      explicit_file_info, {group, zip_group}, {group, zip64_group}].
   58: 
   59: groups() -> 
   60:     zip_groups().
   61: 
   62: %% zip   - Use zip unix tools
   63: %% ezip  - Use erlang zip on disk
   64: %% emzip - Use erlang zip in memory
   65: -define(ZIP_MODES,[zip, ezip, emzip]).
   66: %% -define(ZIP_MODES,[emzip]).
   67: -define(UNZIP_MODES,[unzip, unezip, unemzip]).
   68: %% How much memory the zip/unzip 64 testcases that zip/unzip from/to are expected to use
   69: -define(EMZIP64_MEM_USAGE, (8 * (1 bsl 30))).
   70: 
   71: zip_groups() ->
   72: 
   73:     ZipGroup=
   74:         [{zip_group,[],[{group,ZipMode} || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES]}] ++
   75:         [{ZipMode, [], [{group,UnZipMode} || UnZipMode <- ?UNZIP_MODES]}
   76:          || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES] ++
   77:         [{G, [parallel], zip_testcases()} || G <- ?UNZIP_MODES],
   78: 
   79:     Zip64Group = [{zip64_group,[],[{group,z64(ZipMode)} || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES]}] ++
   80:         [{z64(ZipMode), [sequence], [zip64_central_headers]++
   81:               [{group,z64(UnZipMode)} || UnZipMode <- ?UNZIP_MODES]}
   82:          || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES] ++
   83:         [{z64(G), [], zip64_testcases()} || G <- ?UNZIP_MODES],
   84: 
   85:     ZipGroup ++ Zip64Group.
   86: 
   87: z64(Mode) when is_atom(Mode) ->
   88:     list_to_atom(lists:concat([z64_,Mode]));
   89: z64(Modes) when is_list(Modes) ->
   90:     [z64(M) || M <- Modes].
   91: 
   92: un_z64(Mode) ->
   93:     case atom_to_list(Mode) of
   94:         "z64_" ++ ModeString -> list_to_atom(ModeString);
   95:         _ -> Mode
   96:     end.
   97: 
   98: zip_testcases() ->
   99:     [mode, basic_timestamp, extended_timestamp, uid_gid].
  100: 
  101: zip64_testcases() ->
  102:     [unzip64_central_headers,
  103:      zip64_central_directory].
  104: 
  105: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  106:     {ok, Started} = application:ensure_all_started(os_mon),
  107:     cleanup_priv_dir(Config),
  108:     [{started, Started} | Config].
  109: 
  110: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  111:     [application:stop(App) || App <- lists:reverse(get_value(started, Config))],
  112:     cleanup_priv_dir(Config),
  113:     ok.
  114: 
  115: cleanup_priv_dir(Config) ->
  116:     %% Cleanup potential files in priv_dir
  117:     Pdir = get_value(pdir, Config, get_value(priv_dir,Config)),
  118:     ct:log("Cleaning up ~s",[Pdir]),
  119:     [ case file:delete(File) of
  120:         {error, eperm} -> file:del_dir_r(File);
  121:         _ -> ok
  122:     end || File <- filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Pdir, "*"))].
  123: 
  124: init_per_group(zip64_group, Config) ->
  125:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  126: 
  127:     case {erlang:system_info(wordsize), disc_free(PrivDir), memsize()} of
  128:         {4, _, _} ->
  129:             {skip, "Zip64 tests only work on 64-bit systems"};
  130:         {8, error, _} ->
  131:             {skip, "Failed to query disk space for priv_dir. "
  132:              "Is it on a remote file system?~n"};
  133:         {8, N,M} when N >= 16 * (1 bsl 20), M >= ?EMZIP64_MEM_USAGE ->
  134:             ct:log("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [N]),
  135:             ct:log("Free memory: ~w MByte~n", [M div (1 bsl 20)]),
  136:             OneMB = <<0:(8 bsl 20)>>,
  137:             Large4GB = filename:join(PrivDir, "large.txt"),
  138:             ok = file:write_file(Large4GB, lists:duplicate(4 bsl 10, OneMB)),
  139:             Medium4MB = filename:join(PrivDir, "medium.txt"),
  140:             ok = file:write_file(Medium4MB, lists:duplicate(4, OneMB)),
  141: 
  142:             [{large, Large4GB},{medium,Medium4MB}|Config];
  143:         {8,N,M} ->
  144:             ct:log("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [N]),
  145:             ct:log("Free memory: ~w MByte~n", [M div (1 bsl 20)]),
  146:             {skip,"Less than 16 GByte free disk or less then 8 GB free mem"}
  147:     end;
  148: init_per_group(Group, Config) ->
  149:     case lists:member(Group, ?ZIP_MODES ++ ?UNZIP_MODES ++ z64(?ZIP_MODES ++ ?UNZIP_MODES)) of
  150:         true ->
  151:             case get_value(zip, Config) of
  152:                 undefined ->
  153:                     case un_z64(Group) =/= zip orelse has_zip() of
  154:                         true ->
  155:                             Pdir = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config),Group),
  156:                             ok = filelib:ensure_path(Pdir),
  157:                             [{pdir, Pdir},{zip, Group} | Config];
  158:                         false ->
  159:                             {skip, "No zip program found"}
  160:                     end;
  161:                 _Zip ->
  162:                     case un_z64(Group) =/= unzip orelse has_zip() of
  163:                         true ->
  164:                             Pdir = filename:join(get_value(pdir, Config),Group),
  165:                             ok = filelib:ensure_path(Pdir),
  166:                             [{pdir, Pdir},{unzip, Group} | Config];
  167:                         false ->
  168:                             {skip, "No zip program found"}
  169:                     end
  170:             end;
  171:         false ->
  172:             Config
  173:     end.
  174: 
  175: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  176:     cleanup_priv_dir(Config),
  177:     Config.
  178: 
  179: init_per_testcase(TC, Config) ->
  180:     UsesZip = un_z64(get_value(zip, Config)) =:= zip orelse un_z64(get_value(unzip, Config)) =:= unzip,
  181:     HasZip = has_zip(),
  182:     ct:log("Free memory: ~w MByte~n", [memsize() div (1 bsl 20)]),
  183:     if UsesZip andalso not HasZip ->
  184:             {skip, "No zip command found"};
  185:        true ->
  186:             PrivDir = filename:join(get_value(pdir, Config,get_value(priv_dir, Config)), TC),
  187:             ok = filelib:ensure_path(PrivDir),
  188:             [{pdir, PrivDir} | Config]
  189:     end.
  190: 
  191: 
  192: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  193:     cleanup_priv_dir(Config),
  194:     Config.
  195: 
  196: %% Test creating, listing and extracting one file from an archive
  197: %% multiple times with different file sizes. Also check that the
  198: %% modification date of the extracted file has survived.
  199: borderline(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  200:     RootDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  201:     TempDir = filename:join(RootDir, "borderline"),
  202: 
  203:     Record = 512,
  204:     Block = 20 * Record,
  205: 
  206:     lists:foreach(fun(Size) -> borderline_test(Size, TempDir) end,
  207:                   [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 333, Record-1, Record, Record+1,
  208:                    Block-Record-1, Block-Record, Block-Record+1,
  209:                    Block-1, Block, Block+1,
  210:                    Block+Record-1, Block+Record, Block+Record+1]),
  211: 
  212:     %% Clean up.
  213:     delete_files([TempDir]),
  214:     ok.
  215: 
  216: borderline_test(Size, TempDir) ->
  217:     Archive = filename:join(TempDir, "ar_"++integer_to_list(Size)++".zip"),
  218:     Name = filename:join(TempDir, "file_"++integer_to_list(Size)),
  219:     io:format("Testing size ~p", [Size]),
  220: 
  221:     %% Create a file and archive it.
  222:     {_, _, X0} = erlang:timestamp(),
  223:     file:write_file(Name, random_byte_list(X0, Size)),
  224:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [Name]),
  225:     ok = file:delete(Name),
  226: 
  227:     %% Verify listing and extracting.
  228:     {ok, [#zip_comment{comment = []},
  229:           #zip_file{name = Name,
  230:                     info = Info,
  231:                     offset = 0,
  232:                     comp_size = _}]} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
  233:     Size = Info#file_info.size,
  234:     {ok, [Name]} = zip:extract(Archive, [verbose]),
  235: 
  236:     %% Verify contents of extracted file.
  237:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Name),
  238:     true = match_byte_list(X0, binary_to_list(Bin)),
  239: 
  240: 
  241:     %% Verify that Unix zip can read it. (if we have a unix zip that is!)
  242:     zipinfo_match(Archive, Name),
  243: 
  244:     ok.
  245: 
  246: zipinfo_match(Archive, Name) ->
  247:     case check_zipinfo_exists() of
  248:         true ->
  249:             Encoding = file:native_name_encoding(),
  250:             Expect = unicode:characters_to_binary(Name ++ "\n",
  251:                                                   Encoding, Encoding),
  252:             cmd_expect("zipinfo -1 " ++ Archive, Expect);
  253:         _ ->
  254:             ok
  255:     end.
  256: 
  257: check_zipinfo_exists() ->
  258:     is_list(os:find_executable("zipinfo")).
  259: 
  260: cmd_expect(Cmd, Expect) ->
  261:     Port = open_port({spawn, make_cmd(Cmd)}, [stream, in, binary, eof]),
  262:     get_data(Port, Expect, <<>>).
  263: 
  264: get_data(Port, Expect, Acc) ->
  265:     receive
  266:         {Port, {data, Bytes}} ->
  267:             get_data(Port, Expect, <<Acc/binary, Bytes/binary>>);
  268:         {Port, eof} ->
  269:             Port ! {self(), close},
  270:             receive
  271:                 {Port, closed} ->
  272:                     true
  273:             end,
  274:             receive
  275:                 {'EXIT',  Port,  _} ->
  276:                     ok
  277:             after 1 ->                          % force context switch
  278:                     ok
  279:             end,
  280:             match_output(Acc, Expect, Port)
  281:     end.
  282: 
  283: match_output(<<C, Output/bits>>, <<C,Expect/bits>>, Port) ->
  284:     match_output(Output, Expect, Port);
  285: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>, <<_, _/bits>>, Port) ->
  286:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, badmatch);
  287: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>=Rest, <<>>, Port) ->
  288:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, {too_much_data, Rest});
  289: match_output(<<>>, <<>>, _Port) ->
  290:     ok.
  291: 
  292: kill_port_and_fail(Port, Reason) ->
  293:     unlink(Port),
  294:     exit(Port, die),
  295:     ct:fail(Reason).
  296: 
  297: make_cmd(Cmd) ->
  298:     Cmd.
  299: %%     case os:type() of
  300: %%      {win32, _} -> lists:concat(["cmd /c",  Cmd]);
  301: %%      {unix, _}  -> lists:concat(["sh -c '",  Cmd,  "'"])
  302: %%     end.
  303: 
  304: %% Verifies a random byte list.
  305: 
  306: match_byte_list(X0, [Byte|Rest]) ->
  307:     X = next_random(X0),
  308:     case (X bsr 26) band 16#ff of
  309:         Byte -> match_byte_list(X, Rest);
  310:         _ -> false
  311:     end;
  312: match_byte_list(_, []) ->
  313:     true.
  314: 
  315: %% Generates a random byte list.
  316: 
  317: random_byte_list(X0, Count) ->
  318:     random_byte_list(X0, Count, []).
  319: 
  320: random_byte_list(X0, Count, Result) when Count > 0->
  321:     X = next_random(X0),
  322:     random_byte_list(X, Count-1, [(X bsr 26) band 16#ff|Result]);
  323: random_byte_list(_X, 0, Result) ->
  324:     lists:reverse(Result).
  325: 
  326: %% This RNG is from line 21 on page 102 in Knuth: The Art of Computer Programming,
  327: %% Volume II, Seminumerical Algorithms.
  328: 
  329: next_random(X) ->
  330:     (X*17059465+1) band 16#fffffffff.
  331: 
  332: %% Test the 'atomic' operations: zip/unzip/list_dir, on archives.
  333: %% Also test the 'cooked' option.
  334: atomic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  335:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  336:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  337:     Names = [Name || {Name,_,_} <- DataFiles],
  338:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  339: 
  340:     %% Create a zip  archive.
  341: 
  342:     Zip2 = "zip.zip",
  343:     {ok, Zip2} = zip:zip(Zip2, Names, []),
  344:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip2)),
  345: 
  346:     %% Same test again, but this time created with 'cooked'
  347: 
  348:     Zip3 = "cooked.zip",
  349:     {ok, Zip3} = zip:zip(Zip3, Names, [cooked]),
  350:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3)),
  351:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3, [cooked])),
  352: 
  353:     %% Clean up.
  354:     delete_files([Zip2,Zip3|Names]),
  355: 
  356:     ok.
  357: 
  358: %% Test the zip_open/2, zip_get/1, zip_get/2, zip_close/1,
  359: %% and zip_list_dir/1 functions.
  360: zip_api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  361:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  362:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  363:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  364:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  365: 
  366:     %% Create a zip archive
  367:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  368:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, Names, []),
  369: 
  370:     %% Open archive
  371:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  372: 
  373:     %% List dir
  374:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  375: 
  376:     %% Get a file
  377:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  378:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(Name1),
  379:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  380:     Data1Crc = erlang:crc32(Data1),
  381:     {ok, Data1Crc} = zip:zip_get_crc32(Name1, ZipSrv),
  382: 
  383:     %% Get all files
  384:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(Name),
  385:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  386:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  387: 
  388:     %% Close
  389:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  390: 
  391:     %% Clean up.
  392:     delete_files([Names]),
  393: 
  394:     ok.
  395: 
  396: %% Test that zip doesn't leak processes and ports where the
  397: %% controlling process dies without closing an zip opened with
  398: %% zip:zip_open/1.
  399: open_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  400:     %% Create a zip archive
  401:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  402:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, [], []),
  403: 
  404:     %% Open archive in a another process that dies immediately.
  405:     ZipSrv = spawn_zip(Zip, [memory]),
  406: 
  407:     %% Expect the ZipSrv process to die soon after.
  408:     true = spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv),
  409: 
  410:     %% Clean up.
  411:     delete_files([Zip]),
  412: 
  413:     ok.
  414: 
  415: spawn_zip(Zip, Options) ->
  416:     Self = self(),
  417:     spawn(fun() -> Self ! zip:zip_open(Zip, Options) end),
  418:     receive
  419:         {ok, ZipSrv} ->
  420:             ZipSrv
  421:     end.
  422: 
  423: spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv) ->
  424:     Ref = monitor(process, ZipSrv),
  425:     receive
  426:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, ZipSrv, _} ->
  427:             true
  428:     after 1000 ->
  429:             false
  430:     end.
  431: 
  432: %% Test options for unzip, only cwd and file_list currently.
  433: unzip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  434:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  435:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  436:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  437: 
  438:     %% create a temp directory
  439:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "t"),
  440:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  441: 
  442:     FList = ["quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt"],
  443: 
  444:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  445:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},
  446: 				     {file_list, FList}]),
  447: 
  448:     %% Verify.
  449:     true = (length(FList) =:= length(RetList)),
  450:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  451: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  452: 		  FList),
  453:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  454: 		  RetList),
  455: 
  456:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  457:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  458: 
  459:     FList2 = ["abc.txt","quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt","emptyFile"],
  460: 
  461:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  462:     {ok, RetList2} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},skip_directories]),
  463: 
  464:     %% Verify.
  465:     true = (length(RetList2) =:= 4),
  466:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  467: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  468: 		  FList2),
  469:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> 1 = delete_files([F]) end,
  470: 		  RetList2),
  471: 
  472:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  473:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  474:     ok.
  475: 
  476: %% Test that unzip handles directory traversal exploit (OTP-13633)
  477: unzip_traversal_exploit(Config) ->
  478:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  479:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  480:     ZipName = filename:join(DataDir, "exploit.zip"),
  481: 
  482:     %% $ zipinfo -1 test/zip_SUITE_data/exploit.zip 
  483:     %% clash.txt
  484:     %% ../clash.txt
  485:     %% ../above.txt
  486:     %% subdir/../in_root_dir.txt
  487: 
  488:     %% create a temp directory
  489:     SubDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "exploit_test"),
  490:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  491:     
  492:     ClashFile = filename:join(SubDir,"clash.txt"),
  493:     AboveFile = filename:join(SubDir,"above.txt"),
  494:     RelativePathFile = filename:join(SubDir,"subdir/../in_root_dir.txt"),
  495: 
  496:     %% unzip in SubDir
  497:     {ok, [ClashFile, ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  498: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir}]),
  499: 
  500:     {ok,<<"This file will overwrite other file.\n">>} =
  501: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  502:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(AboveFile),
  503:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(RelativePathFile),
  504: 
  505:     %% clean up
  506:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  507:     
  508:      %% create the temp directory again
  509:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  510: 
  511:     %% unzip in SubDir
  512:     {ok, [ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  513: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir},keep_old_files]),
  514: 
  515:     {ok,<<"This is the original file.\n">>} =
  516: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  517:    
  518:     %% clean up
  519:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  520:     ok.
  521: 
  522: %% Test unzip a jar file (OTP-7382).
  523: unzip_jar(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  524:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  525:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  526:     JarFile = filename:join(DataDir, "test.jar"),
  527: 
  528:     %% create a temp directory
  529:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "jartest"),
  530:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  531: 
  532:     FList = ["META-INF/MANIFEST.MF","test.txt"],
  533: 
  534:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(JarFile, [{cwd, Subdir}]),
  535: 
  536:     %% Verify.
  537:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  538: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  539: 		  FList),
  540:     lists:foreach(fun(F)->
  541:                           case lists:last(F) =:= $/ of
  542:                               true -> ok = file:del_dir(F);
  543:                               false -> ok = file:delete(F)
  544:                           end
  545:                   end,
  546: 		  lists:reverse(RetList)),
  547: 
  548:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  549:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  550:     ok.
  551: 
  552: %% Test the options for unzip, only cwd currently.
  553: zip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  554:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  555:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  556:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  557:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  558: 
  559:     %% Make sure cwd is not where we get the files
  560:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  561: 
  562:     %% Create a zip archive
  563:     {ok, {_,Zip}} =
  564:         zip:zip("filename_not_used.zip", Names, [memory, {cwd, PrivDir}]),
  565: 
  566:     %% Open archive
  567:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  568: 
  569:     %% List dir
  570:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  571: 
  572:     %% Get a file
  573:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  574:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name1)),
  575:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  576: 
  577:     %% Get all files
  578:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name)),
  579:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  580:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  581: 
  582:     %% Close
  583:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  584: 
  585:     %% Clean up.
  586:     delete_files([Names]),
  587: 
  588:     ok.
  589: 
  590: %% Test the options for list_dir... one day.
  591: list_dir_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  592: 
  593:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  594:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  595: 
  596:     {ok,
  597:      ["abc.txt", "quotes/rain.txt", "empty/", "wikipedia.txt", "emptyFile" ]} =
  598:         zip:list_dir(Archive,[names_only]),
  599: 
  600:     {ok,
  601:      [#zip_comment{},
  602:       #zip_file{ name = "abc.txt" },
  603:       #zip_file{ name = "quotes/rain.txt" },
  604:       #zip_file{ name = "wikipedia.txt" },
  605:       #zip_file{ name = "emptyFile" }
  606:      ]} =  zip:list_dir(Archive,[skip_directories]),
  607: 
  608:     ok.
  609: 
  610: %% convert zip_info as returned from list_dir to a list of names
  611: names_from_list_dir({ok, Info}) ->
  612:     names_from_list_dir(Info);
  613: names_from_list_dir(Info) ->
  614:     tl(lists:map(fun(#zip_file{name = Name}) -> Name;
  615:                     (_) -> ok end, Info)).
  616: 
  617: %% Returns a sequence of characters.
  618: char_seq(N, First) ->
  619:     char_seq(N, First, []).
  620: 
  621: char_seq(0, _, Result) ->
  622:     Result;
  623: char_seq(N, C, Result) when C < 127 ->
  624:     char_seq(N-1, C+1, [C|Result]);
  625: char_seq(N, _, Result) ->
  626:     char_seq(N, $!, Result).
  627: 
  628: data_files() ->
  629:     Files = [{"first_file", 1555, $a},
  630:              {"small_file", 7, $d},
  631:              {"big_file", 23875, $e},
  632:              {"last_file", 7500, $g}],
  633:     create_files(Files),
  634:     Files.
  635: 
  636: create_files([{Name, dir, _First}|Rest]) ->
  637:     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  638:     create_files(Rest);
  639: create_files([{Name, Size, First}|Rest]) when is_integer(Size) ->
  640:     ok = file:write_file(Name, char_seq(Size, First)),
  641:     create_files(Rest);
  642: create_files([]) ->
  643:     ok.
  644:

  649: %%     Name = filename:join(Parent, Dir),
  650: %%     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  651: %%     make_dirs(Rest, Name);
  652: %% make_dirs([], Dir) ->
  653: %%     Dir.

  655: %% Try zip:unzip/1 on some corrupted zip files.
  656: bad_zip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  657:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  658:     try_bad("bad_crc",    {bad_crc, "abc.txt"}, Config),
  659:     try_bad("bad_central_directory", bad_central_directory, Config),
  660:     try_bad("bad_file_header",    bad_file_header, Config),
  661:     try_bad("bad_eocd",    bad_eocd, Config),
  662:     try_bad("enoent", enoent, Config),
  663:     GetNotFound = fun(A) ->
  664:                           {ok, O} = zip:zip_open(A, []),
  665:                           zip:zip_get("not_here", O)
  666:                   end,
  667:     try_bad("abc", file_not_found, GetNotFound, Config),
  668:     ok.
  669: 
  670: try_bad(N, R, Config) ->
  671:     try_bad(N, R, fun(A) -> io:format("name : ~p\n", [A]),
  672:                             zip:unzip(A, [verbose]) end, Config).
  673: 
  674: try_bad(Name0, Reason, What, Config) ->
  675:     %% Intentionally no macros here.
  676: 
  677:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  678:     Name = Name0 ++ ".zip",
  679:     io:format("~nTrying ~s", [Name]),
  680:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
  681:     Expected = {error, Reason},
  682:     case What(Full) of
  683:         Expected ->
  684:             io:format("Result: ~p\n", [Expected]);
  685:         Other ->
  686:             io:format("unzip/2 returned ~p (expected ~p)\n", [Other, Expected]),
  687:             ct:fail({bad_return_value, Other})
  688:     end.
  689: 
  690: %% Test extracting to binary with memory option.
  691: unzip_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  692:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  693:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  694:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "unzip_to_binary"),

  708:                               true ->

  777:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  778:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  779:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract_from_binary"),

  794:

  802:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),
  803:

  805:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),

  808:     delete_files([DestFilename, DestQuote, Archive, ExtractDir]),
  809:

  811:     file:set_cwd(ExtractDir),
  812:

  814:     {ok, [FileName,Quote,Wikipedia,EmptyFile]}
  815:         = zip:unzip(Bin, [skip_directories]),
  816: 
  817:     %% Verify.
  818:     DestFilename = filename:join(ExtractDir, "abc.txt"),
  819:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, FileName)),
  820:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(DestFilename),
  821: 
  822:     DestQuote = filename:join([ExtractDir, "quotes", "rain.txt"]),
  823:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, Quote)),
  824:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),
  825: 
  826:     %% Clean up.
  827:     delete_files([DestFilename, DestQuote, ExtractDir]),
  828: 
  829:     ok.

  831: %% oac_files() ->
  832: %%     Files = [{"oac_file", 1459, $x},
  833: %%           {"oac_small", 99, $w},
  834: %%           {"oac_big", 33896, $A}],

  837: 
  838: %% Delete the given list of files and directories.
  839: %% Return total number of deleted files (not directories)
  840: delete_files(List) ->
  841:     do_delete_files(List, 0).
  842: do_delete_files([],Cnt) ->
  843:     Cnt;
  844: do_delete_files([Item|Rest], Cnt) ->
  845:     case file:delete(Item) of
  846:         ok ->
  847:             DelCnt = 1;
  848:         {error,eperm} ->
  849:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  850:             DelCnt = delete_files(filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Item, "*"))),
  851:             file:del_dir(Item);
  852:         {error,eacces} ->
  853:             %% We'll see about that!
  854:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  855:             case file:delete(Item) of
  856:                 ok ->
  857: 		    DelCnt = 1;
  858:                 {error,_} ->
  859:                     erlang:yield(),
  860:                     file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  861:                     file:delete(Item),
  862:                     DelCnt = 1
  863:             end;
  864:         {error,_} ->
  865:             DelCnt = 0
  866:     end,
  867:     do_delete_files(Rest, Cnt + DelCnt).
  868: 
  869: %% Test control of which files that should be compressed.
  870: compress_control(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  871:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  872:     Dir = "compress_control",
  873:     Files = [
  874:              {Dir,                                                          dir,   $d},
  875:              {filename:join([Dir, "first_file.txt"]), 10000, $f},
  876:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  877:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "zzz.zip"]), 10000, $z},
  878:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "lll.lzh"]), 10000, $l},
  879:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "eee.exe"]), 10000, $e},
  880:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $g},
  881:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  882:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $a},
  883:              {filename:join([Dir, "last_file.txt"]), 10000, $l}
  884:             ],
  885: 
  886:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  887: 			  Files,
  888: 			  [{compress, []}],
  889: 			  []),
  890: 
  891:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  892: 			  Files,
  893: 			  [{uncompress, all}],
  894: 			  []),
  895: 
  896:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  897: 			  Files,
  898: 			  [{uncompress, []}],
  899: 			  [".txt", ".exe", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  900: 
  901:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  902: 			  Files,
  903: 			  [],
  904: 			  [".txt", ".exe"]),
  905: 
  906:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  907: 			  Files,
  908: 			  [{uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  909: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  910: 			  [".txt", ".zip", "arj"]),
  911: 
  912:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  913: 			  Files,
  914: 			  [{uncompress, []},
  915: 			   {uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  916: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  917: 			  [".txt", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  918: 
  919:     ok.
  920: 
  921: test_compress_control(Dir, Files, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  922:     %% Cleanup
  923:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  924:     Names = [N || {N, _, _} <- Files],
  925:     delete_files([Zip]),
  926:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)),
  927: 
  928:     create_files(Files),
  929:     {ok, Zip} = zip:create(Zip, [Dir], ZipOptions),
  930: 
  931:     {ok, OpenZip} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  932:     {ok,[#zip_comment{comment = ""} | ZipList]} = zip:zip_list_dir(OpenZip),
  933:     io:format("compress_control:  -> ~p  -> ~p\n  -> ~pn", [Expected, ZipOptions, ZipList]),
  934:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected),
  935:     ok = zip:zip_close(OpenZip),
  936: 
  937:     %% Cleanup
  938:     delete_files([Zip]),
  939:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)), % Remove plain files before directories
  940: 
  941:     ok.
  942: 
  943: verify_compression([{Name, Kind, _Filler} | Files], ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  944:     {Name2, BinSz} =
  945:         case Kind of
  946:             dir ->
  947:                 {Name ++ "/", 0};
  948:             _   ->
  949:                 {ok, {Name, Bin}} = zip:zip_get(Name, OpenZip),
  950:                 {Name, size(Bin)}
  951:         end,
  952:     {Name2, {value, ZipFile}} = {Name2, lists:keysearch(Name2,  #zip_file.name, ZipList)},
  953:     #zip_file{info = #file_info{size = InfoSz, type = InfoType}, comp_size = InfoCompSz} = ZipFile,
  954: 
  955:     Ext = filename:extension(Name),
  956:     IsComp = is_compressed(Ext, Kind, ZipOptions),
  957:     ExpComp = lists:member(Ext, Expected),
  958:     case {Name, Kind, InfoType, IsComp, ExpComp, BinSz, InfoSz, InfoCompSz} of
  959:         {_, dir, directory, false, _,     Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  960:         {_, Sz,  regular,   false, false, Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  961:         {_, Sz,  regular,   true,  true,  Sz, Sz, OtherSz} when Sz =:= BinSz, OtherSz =/= BinSz -> ok
  962:     end,
  963:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList -- [ZipFile], OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected);
  964: verify_compression([], [], _OpenZip, _ZipOptions, _Expected) ->
  965:     ok.
  966: 
  967: is_compressed(_Ext, dir, _Options) ->
  968:     false;
  969: is_compressed(Ext, _Sz, Options) ->
  970:     CompressOpt =
  971:         case [What || {compress, What} <- Options] of
  972:             [] -> all;
  973:             CompressOpts-> extensions(CompressOpts, all)
  974:         end,
  975:     DoCompress = (CompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, CompressOpt),
  976:     Default = [".Z", ".zip", ".zoo", ".arc", ".lzh", ".arj"],
  977:     UncompressOpt =
  978:         case [What || {uncompress, What} <- Options] of
  979:             [] -> Default;
  980:             UncompressOpts-> extensions(UncompressOpts, Default)
  981:         end,
  982:     DoUncompress = (UncompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, UncompressOpt),
  983:     DoCompress andalso not DoUncompress.
  984: 
  985: extensions([H | T], Old) ->
  986:     case H of
  987:         all ->
  988:             extensions(T, H);
  989:         H when is_list(H) ->
  990:             extensions(T, H);
  991:         {add, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  992:             extensions(T, Old ++ New);
  993:         {del, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  994:             extensions(T, Old -- New);
  995:         _ ->
  996:             extensions(T, Old)
  997:     end;
  998: extensions([], Old) ->
  999:     Old.
 1000: 
 1001: foldl(Config) ->
 1002:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1003:     File = filename:join([PrivDir, "foldl.zip"]),
 1004: 
 1005:     FooBin = <<"FOO">>,
 1006:     BarBin = <<"BAR">>,
 1007:     Files = [{"foo", FooBin}, {"bar", BarBin}],
 1008:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, Files, [memory,{extra,[]}]),
 1009:     ZipFun = fun(N, I, B, Acc) -> [{N, B(), I()} | Acc] end,
 1010:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, Bin}),
 1011:     [{"bar", BarBin, #file_info{}}, {"foo", FooBin, #file_info{}}] = FileSpec,
 1012:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, lists:reverse(FileSpec), [memory,{extra,[]}]),
 1013:     {foo_bin, FooBin} =
 1014: 	try
 1015: 	    zip:foldl(fun("foo", _, B, _) -> throw(B()); (_, _, _, Acc) -> Acc end, [], {File, Bin})
 1016: 	catch
 1017: 	    throw:FooBin ->
 1018: 		{foo_bin, FooBin}
 1019: 	end,
 1020:     ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
 1021:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
 1022: 
 1023:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(fun() -> ok end, [], File),
 1024:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], 42),
 1025:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, 42}),
 1026: 
 1027:     ok = file:delete(File),
 1028:     {error, enoent} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
 1029: 
 1030:     ok.
 1031: 
 1032: fd_leak(Config) ->
 1033:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1034:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1035:     Name = filename:join(DataDir, "bad_file_header.zip"),
 1036:     BadExtract = fun() ->
 1037:                          {error,bad_file_header} = zip:extract(Name),
 1038:                          ok
 1039:                  end,
 1040:     do_fd_leak(BadExtract, 1),
 1041: 
 1042:     BadCreate = fun() ->
 1043:                         {error,enoent} = zip:zip("failed.zip",
 1044:                                                  ["none"]),
 1045:                         ok
 1046:                 end,
 1047:     do_fd_leak(BadCreate, 1),
 1048: 
 1049:     ok.
 1050: 
 1051: do_fd_leak(_Bad, 10000) ->
 1052:     ok;
 1053: do_fd_leak(Bad, N) ->
 1054:     try Bad() of
 1055:         ok ->
 1056:             do_fd_leak(Bad, N + 1)
 1057:     catch
 1058:         C:R:Stk ->
 1059:             io:format("Bad error after ~p attempts\n", [N]),
 1060:             erlang:raise(C, R, Stk)
 1061:     end.
 1062: 
 1063: unicode(Config) ->
 1064:     case file:native_name_encoding() of
 1065:         latin1 ->
 1066:             {comment, "Native name encoding is Latin-1; skipping all tests"};
 1067:         utf8 ->
 1068:             DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1069:             ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1070:             test_file_comment(DataDir),
 1071:             test_archive_comment(DataDir),
 1072:             test_bad_comment(DataDir),
 1073:             test_latin1_archive(DataDir),
 1074:             case has_zip() of
 1075:                 false ->
 1076:                     {comment, "No zip program found; skipping some tests"};
 1077:                 true ->
 1078:                     case zip_is_unicode_aware() of
 1079:                         true ->
 1080:                             test_filename_compatibility(),
 1081:                             ok;
 1082:                         false ->
 1083:                             {comment, "Old zip program; skipping some tests"}
 1084:                     end
 1085:             end
 1086:     end.
 1087: 
 1088: test_filename_compatibility() ->
 1089:     FancyName = "d",
 1090:     Archive = "test.zip",
 1091: 
 1092:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [{FancyName, <<"test">>}]),
 1093:     zipinfo_match(Archive, FancyName).
 1094: 
 1095: test_file_comment(DataDir) ->
 1096:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_file_comment.zip"),
 1097:     Comments = ["a", [246], [1024]],
 1098:     FileNames = [[C] ++ ".txt" || C <- [$a, 246, 1024]],
 1099:     [begin
 1100:          test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive),
 1101:          test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive)
 1102:      end ||
 1103:         Comment <- Comments, FileName <- FileNames],
 1104:     ok.
 1105: 
 1106: test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
 1107:     _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1108:     io:format("*** zip:zip(). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
 1109:               [FileName, Comment]),
 1110:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1111:     {ok, Archive} =
 1112:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
 1113:     zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "").
 1114: 
 1115: test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
 1116:     case test_zip1() of
 1117:         false ->
 1118:             ok;
 1119:         true ->
 1120:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1121:             io:format("*** zip(1). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
 1122:                       [FileName, Comment]),
 1123:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1124:             R = os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -c " ++
 1125:                            Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
 1126:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [R]),
 1127:             zip_check(Archive, "", FileName, Comment)
 1128:     end.
 1129: 
 1130: test_archive_comment(DataDir) ->
 1131:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_archive_comment.zip"),
 1132:     Chars = [$a, 246, 1024],
 1133:     [test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) || Char <- Chars],
 1134:     ok.
 1135: 
 1136: test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) ->
 1137:     case test_zip1() of
 1138:         false ->
 1139:             ok;
 1140:         true ->
 1141:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1142:             FileName = "a.txt",
 1143:             Comment = [Char],
 1144:             io:format("*** Testing archive Comment ~ts\n", [Comment]),
 1145:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1146: 
 1147:             {ok, _} =
 1148:                 zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
 1149:             Res = os:cmd("zip -z " ++ Archive),
 1150:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [Res]),
 1151:             true = lists:member(Char, Res),
 1152: 
 1153:             os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -z "++
 1154:                        Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
 1155:             zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "")
 1156:     end.
 1157: 
 1158: test_zip1() ->
 1159:     has_zip() andalso zip_is_unicode_aware().
 1160: 
 1161: has_zip() ->
 1162:     os:find_executable("zip") =/= false andalso element(1, os:type()) =:= unix.
 1163: 
 1164: zip_is_unicode_aware() ->
 1165:     S = os:cmd("zip -v | grep 'UNICODE_SUPPORT'"),
 1166:     string:find(S, "UNICODE_SUPPORT") =/= nomatch.
 1167: 
 1168: zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, FileNameComment) ->
 1169:     {ok, CommentAndFiles} = zip:table(Archive),
 1170:     io:format("zip:table/1 returns\n  ~lp\n", [CommentAndFiles]),
 1171:     io:format("checking archive comment ~lp\n", [ArchiveComment]),
 1172:     [_] = [C || #zip_comment{comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1173:                 C =:= ArchiveComment],
 1174:     io:format("checking filename ~lp\n", [FileName]),
 1175:     io:format("and filename comment ~lp\n", [FileNameComment]),
 1176:     [_] = [F || #zip_file{name = F, comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1177:                 F =:= FileName, C =:= FileNameComment],
 1178:     {ok, FileList} = zip:unzip(Archive, [verbose]),
 1179:     io:format("zip:unzip/2 returns\n  ~lp\n", [FileList]),
 1180:     true = lists:member(FileName, FileList),
 1181:     ok.
 1182: 
 1183: test_bad_comment(DataDir) ->
 1184:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_bad_comment.zip"),
 1185:     FileName = "a.txt",
 1186:     file:write_file(FileName, ["something"]),
 1187:     Comment = [9999999],
 1188:     {error,{bad_unicode,Comment}} =
 1189:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]).
 1190: 
 1191: test_latin1_archive(DataDir) ->
 1192:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip-latin1.zip"),
 1193:     FileName = [246] ++ ".txt",
 1194:     ArchiveComment = [246],
 1195:     zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, "").
 1196: 
 1197: test_zip_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1198:     case {os:find_executable("unzip"), os:type()} of
 1199:         {UnzipPath, {unix,_}} when is_list(UnzipPath)->
 1200:             DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1201:             Dir = filename:join([DataDir, "test-zip", "dir-1"]),
 1202:             TestZipOutputDir = filename:join(DataDir, "test-zip-output"),
 1203:             TestZipOutput = filename:join(TestZipOutputDir, "test.zip"),
 1204:             zip:create(TestZipOutput, [Dir]),
 1205:             run_command(UnzipPath, ["-o", TestZipOutput,  "-d", TestZipOutputDir]),
 1206:             {ok, FileContent} = file:read_file(filename:join([TestZipOutputDir, Dir, "file.txt"])),
 1207:             <<"OKOK\n">> = FileContent,
 1208:             ok;
 1209:         _ -> {skip, "Not Unix or unzip program not found"}
 1210:     end.
 1211: 
 1212: run_command(Command, Args) ->
 1213:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_executable, Command}, [{args, Args}, exit_status]),
 1214:     (fun Reciver() ->
 1215:              receive
 1216:                  {Port,{exit_status,_}} -> ok;
 1217:                  {Port, S} -> io:format("UNZIP: ~p~n", [S]),
 1218:                               Reciver()
 1219:              end
 1220:      end)().
 1221:     
 1222: explicit_file_info(_Config) ->
 1223:     Epoch = {{1980,1,1},{0,0,0}},
 1224:     FileInfo = #file_info{type=regular, size=0, mtime=Epoch},
 1225:     Files = [{"datetime", <<>>, FileInfo},
 1226:              {"seconds", <<>>, FileInfo#file_info{mtime=315532800}}],
 1227:     {ok, _} = zip:zip("", Files, [memory]),
 1228:     ok.
 1229: 
 1230: mode(Config) ->
 1231: 
 1232:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1233:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1234:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1235: 
 1236:     Executable = filename:join(PrivDir,"exec"),
 1237:     file:write_file(Executable, "aaa"),
 1238:     {ok, ExecFI } = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1239:     ok = file:write_file_info(Executable, ExecFI#file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400 }),
 1240:     {ok, #file_info{ mode = OrigExecMode }} = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1241: 
 1242:     Directory = filename:join(PrivDir,"dir"),
 1243:     ok = file:make_dir(Directory),
 1244:     {ok, DirFI } = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1245:     ok = file:write_file_info(Directory, DirFI#file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400 }),
 1246:     {ok, #file_info{ mode = OrigDirMode }} = file:read_file_info(Directory),
 1247: 
 1248:     ?assertMatch(
 1249:        {ok, Archive},
 1250:        zip(Config, Archive, "-r", ["dir","exec"], [{cwd, PrivDir},{extra,[extended_timestamp]}])),
 1251: 
 1252:     OrigExecMode777 = OrigExecMode band 8#777,
 1253:     OrigDirMode777 = OrigDirMode band 8#777,
 1254: 
 1255:     ?assertMatch(
 1256:        {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1257:              #zip_file{ name = "dir/", info = #file_info{ mode = OrigDirMode777 }},
 1258:              #zip_file{ name = "exec", info = #file_info{ mode = OrigExecMode777 }} ]},
 1259:        zip:list_dir(Archive)),
 1260: 
 1261:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1262:     ?assertMatch(
 1263:        {ok, ["dir/","exec"]}, unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1264: 
 1265:     case un_z64(get_value(unzip, Config)) =/= unemzip of
 1266:         true ->
 1267:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = ExecMode }} =
 1268:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"exec")),
 1269:             ?assertEqual(ExecMode band 8#777, OrigExecMode777),
 1270: 
 1271:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = DirMode }} =
 1272:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"dir")),
 1273:             ?assertEqual(DirMode band 8#777, OrigDirMode777);
 1274:         false ->
 1275:             %% emzip does not support mode
 1276:             ok
 1277:     end,
 1278: 
 1279:     ok.
 1280: 
 1281: %% Test that zip64 local and central headers are respected when unzipping.
 1282: %% The fields in the header that can be 64-bit are:
 1283: %%  * compressed size
 1284: %%  * uncompressed size
 1285: %%  * relative offset
 1286: %%  * starting disk
 1287: %%
 1288: %% As we do not support using multiple disks, we do not test starting disks
 1289: zip64_central_headers(Config) ->
 1290: 
 1291:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1292:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "../archive.zip"),
 1293: 
 1294:     %% Check that ../../large.txt exists and is of correct size
 1295:     {ok, #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } } =
 1296:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt")),
 1297: 
 1298:     %% We very carefully create an archive that should contain all
 1299:     %% different header combinations.
 1300:     %% - uncomp.txt: uncomp size > 4GB
 1301:     %% - uncomp.comp.zip: uncomp and comp size > 4GB
 1302:     %% - offset.txt: offset > 4GB
 1303:     %% - uncomp.offset.txt: uncomp size and offset > 4GB
 1304:     %% - uncomp.comp.offset.zip: uncomp and comp size and offset > 4GB
 1305:     %%
 1306:     %% The archive will be roughly 8 GBs large
 1307: 
 1308:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1309:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.txt")),
 1310:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1311:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.comp.zip")),
 1312:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../medium.txt"),
 1313:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "offset.txt")),
 1314:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1315:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.offset.txt")),
 1316:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1317:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.comp.offset.zip")),
 1318:     ?assertMatch(
 1319:        {ok, Archive},
 1320:        zip(Config, Archive, "-1",
 1321:            ["uncomp.txt","uncomp.comp.zip","offset.txt",
 1322:             "uncomp.offset.txt","uncomp.comp.offset.zip"],
 1323:            [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1324: 
 1325:     %% Check that list archive works
 1326:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1327:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.txt",
 1328:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1329:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.comp.zip",
 1330:                      comp_size = 1 bsl 32,
 1331:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1332:           #zip_file{ name = "offset.txt",
 1333:                      info = #file_info{ size = 4 bsl 20 } },
 1334:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.offset.txt",
 1335:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1336:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.comp.offset.zip",
 1337:                      comp_size = 1 bsl 32,
 1338:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } }
 1339:          ]} =
 1340:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1341:     ok.
 1342: 
 1343: unzip64_central_headers(Config) ->
 1344: 
 1345:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1346:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1347:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "../../archive.zip"),
 1348:     Large4GB = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config),"large.txt"),
 1349:     Medium4MB = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config), "medium.txt"),
 1350: 
 1351:     %% Test that extraction of each file works
 1352:     lists:map(
 1353:       fun F({Name, Compare}) ->
 1354:               ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1355:               ?assertMatch(
 1356:                  {ok, [Name]},
 1357:                  unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{file_list,[Name]}])),
 1358:               cmp(Compare, filename:join(ExtractDir,Name)),
 1359:               file:del_dir_r(ExtractDir);
 1360:           F(Name) ->
 1361:               F({Name, Large4GB})
 1362:       end, ["uncomp.txt","uncomp.comp.zip",{"offset.txt",Medium4MB},
 1363:             "uncomp.offset.txt","uncomp.comp.offset.zip"]),
 1364: 
 1365:     ok.
 1366: 
 1367: %% Test that zip64 end of central directory are respected when unzipping.
 1368: %% The fields in the header that can be 64-bit are:
 1369: %%   * total number of files > 2 bytes
 1370: %%   * size of central directory > 4 bytes (cannot test as it requires an archive with 8 million files)
 1371: %%   * offset of central directory > 4 bytes (implicitly tested when testing large relative location of header)
 1372: %%
 1373: %% Fields that we don't test as we don't support multiple disks
 1374: %%   * number of disk where end of central directory is > 2 bytes
 1375: %%   * number of disk to find central directory > 2 bytes
 1376: %%   * number central directory entries on this disk > 2 bytes
 1377: zip64_central_directory(Config) ->
 1378: 
 1379:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1380:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "files"),
 1381:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1382: 
 1383:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1384: 
 1385:     %% To test when total number of files > 65535, we create an archive with 66000 entries
 1386:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
 1387:     lists:foreach(
 1388:       fun(I) ->
 1389:               ok = file:write_file(filename:join(Dir, integer_to_list(I)++".txt"),<<0:8>>)
 1390:       end, lists:seq(0, 65600)),
 1391:     ?assertMatch(
 1392:        {ok, Archive},
 1393:        zip(Config, Archive, "-1 -r", ["files"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1394: 
 1395:     {ok, Files} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1396:     ?assertEqual(65603, length(Files)),
 1397: 
 1398:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1399:     ?assertMatch(
 1400:        {ok, ["files/1.txt","files/65599.txt"]},
 1401:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{file_list,["files/1.txt",
 1402:                                                              "files/65599.txt"]}])),
 1403:     cmp(filename:join(ExtractDir,"files/1.txt"),
 1404:         filename:join(ExtractDir,"files/65599.txt")),
 1405: 
 1406:     ok.
 1407: 
 1408: %% Test basic timestamps, the atime and mtime should be the original
 1409: %% mtime of the file
 1410: basic_timestamp(Config) ->
 1411:     PrivDir =  get_value(pdir, Config),
 1412:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1413:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1414:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1415: 
 1416:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1417:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ mtime = Mtime }} =
 1418:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1419: 
 1420:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1421:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1422: 
 1423:     %% Create an archive without extended timestamps
 1424:     ?assertMatch(
 1425:        {ok, Archive},
 1426:        zip(Config, Archive, "-X", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}, {extra, []}])),
 1427: 
 1428:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1429:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ mtime = ZMtime }} ]} =
 1430:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1431: 
 1432:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1433:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1434:     ct:log("zipinfo:~n~ts",[os:cmd("zipinfo -v "++Archive)]),
 1435: 
 1436:     %% Timestamp in archive is when entry was added to archive
 1437:     %% Need to add 2 to ZMtime as the dos time in zip archives
 1438:     %% are in precise.
 1439:     ?assert(calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(Mtime) =<
 1440:                 calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(ZMtime) + 1),
 1441: 
 1442:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1443:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1444: 
 1445:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1446:     ?assertMatch(
 1447:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1448:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1449: 
 1450:     {ok, UnzipFI = #file_info{ atime = UnZAtime,
 1451:                                mtime = UnZMtime,
 1452:                                ctime = UnZCtime
 1453:                              }} =
 1454:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir, "testfile.txt"),[raw]),
 1455: 
 1456: 
 1457:     ct:log("extract: ~p",[UnzipFI]),
 1458: 
 1459:     UnzipMode = un_z64(get_value(unzip, Config)),
 1460: 
 1461:     if UnzipMode =/= unemzip ->
 1462:             ?assertEqual(ZMtime, UnZMtime),
 1463: 
 1464:             %% When using unzip, the atime is sometimes set to ctime for unknown reasons... so we cannot test it
 1465:             %% ?assertEqual(UnZAtime, UnZMtime),
 1466:             ?assert(UnZAtime =:= UnZMtime orelse UnZAtime =:= UnZCtime),
 1467: 
 1468:             %% On windows the ctime and mtime are the same so
 1469:             %% we cannot compare them.
 1470:             [?assert(UnZMtime < UnZCtime) || os:type() =/= {win32,nt}];
 1471:         UnzipMode =:= unemzip ->
 1472:             %% emzip does not support timestamps
 1473:             ok
 1474:     end,
 1475: 
 1476:     ok.
 1477: 
 1478: %% Test extended timestamps, the atime and ctime in the archive are
 1479: %% the atime and ctime when the file is added to the archive.
 1480: extended_timestamp(Config) ->
 1481: 
 1482:     PrivDir =  get_value(pdir, Config),
 1483:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1484:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1485:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1486: 
 1487:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1488:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ mtime = Mtime }} =
 1489:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1490: 
 1491:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1492:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1493: 
 1494:     ?assertMatch(
 1495:        {ok, Archive},
 1496:        zip(Config, Archive, "", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1497: 
 1498:     %% list_dir only reads the central directory header and thus only
 1499:     %% the mtime will be correct here
 1500:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1501:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ mtime = ZMtime}} ]} =
 1502:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1503: 
 1504:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1505:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1506:     ct:log("zipinfo:~n~ts",[os:cmd("zipinfo -v "++Archive)]),
 1507: 
 1508:     ?assertEqual(Mtime, ZMtime),
 1509: 
 1510:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1511:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1512: 
 1513:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1514:     ?assertMatch(
 1515:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1516:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1517: 
 1518:     {ok, UnzipFI = #file_info{ atime = UnZAtime,
 1519:                                mtime = UnZMtime,
 1520:                                ctime = UnZCtime
 1521:                              }} =
 1522:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir, "testfile.txt"),[raw]),
 1523: 
 1524:     ct:log("extract: ~p",[UnzipFI]),
 1525: 
 1526:     UnzipMode = un_z64(get_value(unzip, Config)),
 1527: 
 1528:     if UnzipMode =/= unemzip ->
 1529:             ?assertEqual(ZMtime, UnZMtime),
 1530: 
 1531:             %% When using unzip, the atime is sometimes set to ctime for unknown reasons... so we cannot test it
 1532:             %% ?assertEqual(UnZAtime, UnZMtime),
 1533:             ?assert(UnZAtime =:= UnZMtime orelse UnZAtime =:= UnZCtime),
 1534: 
 1535:             %% On windows the ctime and mtime are the same so
 1536:             %% we cannot compare them.
 1537:             [?assert(UnZMtime < UnZCtime) || os:type() =/= {win32,nt}];
 1538:         UnzipMode =:= unemzip ->
 1539:             %% emzip does not support timestamps
 1540:             ok
 1541:     end,
 1542: 
 1543:     ok.
 1544: 
 1545: uid_gid(Config) ->
 1546: 
 1547:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1548:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1549:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1550:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1551: 
 1552:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1553:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ gid = GID, uid = UID }} =
 1554:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1555: 
 1556:     ?assertMatch(
 1557:        {ok, Archive},
 1558:        zip(Config, Archive, "", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1559: 
 1560:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1561:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ gid = ZGID, uid = ZUID }} ]} =
 1562:         zip:list_dir(Archive,[{extra, [uid_gid]}]),
 1563: 
 1564:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1565:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1566: 
 1567:     ?assertEqual(UID, ZUID),
 1568:     ?assertEqual(GID, ZGID),
 1569: 
 1570:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1571:     ?assertMatch(
 1572:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1573:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{extra,[uid_gid]}])),
 1574: 
 1575:     {ok,#file_info{ gid = ExZGID, uid = ExZUID }} =
 1576:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"testfile.txt")),
 1577: 
 1578:     case un_z64(get_value(unzip, Config)) =/= unemzip of
 1579:         true ->
 1580:             ?assertEqual(UID, ExZUID),
 1581:             ?assertEqual(GID, ExZGID);
 1582:         _ ->
 1583:             %% emzip does not support uid_gid
 1584:             ok
 1585:     end,
 1586: 
 1587:     ok.
 1588: 
 1589: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1590: %%% Generic zip interface
 1591: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1592: zip(Config, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) when is_list(Config) ->
 1593:     zip(get_value(zip, Config),
 1594:         Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts);
 1595: zip(z64_zip, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1596:     zip(zip, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts);
 1597: zip(zip, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1598:     cmd("cd "++get_value(cwd, Opts)++" && "
 1599:         "zip "++ZipOpts++" "++Archive++" "++lists:join($ ,Filelist)),
 1600:     {ok, Archive};
 1601: zip(z64_ezip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1602:     zip(ezip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts);
 1603: zip(ezip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1604:     ct:log("Creating zip:zip(~p,~n~p,~n~p)",[Archive, Filelist, Opts]),
 1605:     zip:zip(Archive, Filelist, Opts);
 1606: zip(z64_emzip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1607:     %% Run in peer node so that memory issues don't crash test node
 1608:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => emzip_peer_args() }),
 1609:     try
 1610:         erpc:call(
 1611:           Node,
 1612:           fun() ->
 1613:             ?MODULE:zip(emzip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts)
 1614:           end)
 1615:     after
 1616:         catch peer:stop(Peer)
 1617:     end;
 1618: zip(emzip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1619:     ct:log("Creating emzip ~ts",[Archive]),
 1620:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts),
 1621: 
 1622:     
 1623:     %% For this not to use a huge amount of memory we re-use
 1624:     %% the binary for files that are the same size as those are the same file.
 1625:     %% This cuts memory usage from ~16GB to ~4GB.
 1626: 
 1627:     {Files,_Cache} =
 1628:         lists:mapfoldl(
 1629:         fun F(Fn, Cache) ->
 1630:                 AbsFn = filename:join(Cwd, Fn),
 1631:                 {ok, Fi} = file:read_file_info(AbsFn),
 1632:                 CacheKey = {Fi#file_info.type, Fi#file_info.size},
 1633:                 {SubDirFiles, NewCache} =
 1634:                     if Fi#file_info.type == directory ->
 1635:                             {ok, Files} = file:list_dir(AbsFn),
 1636:                             lists:mapfoldl(F, Cache#{ CacheKey => <<>> },
 1637:                                             [filename:join(Fn, DirFn) || DirFn <- Files]);
 1638:                         Fi#file_info.type == regular ->
 1639:                             {[],
 1640:                                 case maps:find(CacheKey, Cache) of
 1641:                                     {ok, _} -> Cache;
 1642:                                     error ->
 1643:                                         {ok, Data} = read_file(
 1644:                                                     file:open(AbsFn, [read, raw, binary]),
 1645:                                                     Fi#file_info.size),
 1646:                                         Cache#{ CacheKey => Data }
 1647:                                 end}
 1648:                     end,
 1649:                 {[{Fn, maps:get(CacheKey, NewCache), Fi}|SubDirFiles], NewCache}
 1650:         end,  #{}, Filelist),
 1651:     zip:zip(Archive, lists:flatten(Files), proplists:delete(cwd,Opts)).
 1652: 
 1653: %% Special read_file that works on windows on > 4 GB files
 1654: read_file({ok, D}, Size) ->
 1655:     Bin = iolist_to_binary(read_file(D, Size)),
 1656:     erlang:garbage_collect(), %% Do a GC to get rid of all intermediate binaries
 1657:     {ok, Bin};
 1658: read_file({error, _} = E, _Size) ->
 1659:     E;
 1660: read_file(eof = E, _Size) ->
 1661:     E;
 1662: read_file(D, 0) ->
 1663:     file:close(D),
 1664:     [];
 1665: read_file(D, Size) ->
 1666:     {ok, B} = file:read(D, min(1 bsl 30, Size)),
 1667:     [B | read_file(D, Size - byte_size(B))].
 1668: 
 1669: unzip(Config, Archive, Opts) when is_list(Config) ->
 1670:     unzip(get_value(unzip, Config), Archive, Opts);
 1671: unzip(z64_unzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1672:     unzip(unzip, Archive, Opts);
 1673: unzip(unzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1674:     UidGid = [" -X " || lists:member(uid_gid, get_value(extra, Opts, []))],
 1675:     Files = lists:join($ , get_value(file_list, Opts, [])),
 1676:     Res = cmd("cd "++get_value(cwd, Opts)++" && "
 1677:               "unzip "++UidGid++" "++Archive++" "++Files),
 1678:     {ok, lists:sort(
 1679:            lists:flatmap(
 1680:              fun(Ln) ->
 1681:                      case re:run(Ln, ~B'\s+[a-z]+: ([^\s]+)', [{capture,all_but_first,list},unicode]) of
 1682:                          nomatch -> [];
 1683:                          {match,Match} -> Match
 1684:                      end
 1685:              end,string:split(Res,"\n",all)))};
 1686: unzip(z64_unezip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1687:     unzip(unezip, Archive, Opts);
 1688: unzip(unezip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1689:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts) ++ "/",
 1690:     {ok, Files} = zip:unzip(Archive, Opts),
 1691:     {ok, lists:sort([F -- Cwd || F <- Files])};
 1692: unzip(z64_unemzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1693:     %% Run in peer node so that memory issues don't crash test node
 1694:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => emzip_peer_args() }),
 1695:     try
 1696:       erpc:call(
 1697:         Node,
 1698:         fun() ->
 1699:             unzip(unemzip, Archive, Opts)
 1700:         end)
 1701:     after
 1702:         catch peer:stop(Peer)
 1703:     end;
 1704: unzip(unemzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1705:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts) ++ "/",
 1706:     
 1707:     {ok, Files} = zip:unzip(Archive, [memory | Opts]),
 1708:     {ok, lists:sort(
 1709:             [begin
 1710:                 case lists:last(F) of
 1711:                     $/ ->
 1712:                         filelib:ensure_path(F);
 1713:                     _ ->
 1714:                         filelib:ensure_dir(F),
 1715:                         file:write_file(F, B)
 1716:                 end,
 1717:                 F -- Cwd
 1718:             end || {F, B} <- Files])}.
 1719: 
 1720: emzip_peer_args() ->
 1721:     8 = erlang:system_info(wordsize),%% Supercarrier only supported on 64-bit
 1722:     ["+MMscs",integer_to_list(?EMZIP64_MEM_USAGE div (1024 * 1024))].
 1723: 
 1724: cmp(Source, Target) ->
 1725:     {ok, SrcInfo} = file:read_file_info(Source),
 1726:     {ok, TgtInfo} = file:read_file_info(Target),
 1727:     ?assertEqual(SrcInfo#file_info.size, TgtInfo#file_info.size),
 1728:     ?assertEqual(SrcInfo#file_info.mode, TgtInfo#file_info.mode),
 1729: 
 1730:     {ok, Src} = file:open(Source, [read, binary]),
 1731:     {ok, Tgt} = file:open(Target, [read, binary]),
 1732: 
 1733:     cmp(Src, Tgt, 0),
 1734: 
 1735:     file:close(Src),
 1736:     file:close(Tgt).
 1737: 
 1738: %% Check if first 100 MB are the same
 1739: cmp(Src, Tgt, Pos) when Pos < 100 bsl 20 ->
 1740:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1741:     case {file:read(Src, 20 bsl 20), file:read(Tgt, 20 bsl 20)} of
 1742:         {{ok, Data}, {ok, Data}} ->
 1743:             cmp(Src, Tgt, Pos + 20 bsl 20);
 1744:         {E, E} ->
 1745:             ok
 1746:     end;
 1747: cmp(_Src, _Tgt, _) ->
 1748:     ok.
 1749: 
 1750: cmd(Cmd) ->
 1751:     Res = os:cmd(Cmd),
 1752:     ct:log("Cmd: ~ts~nRes: ~ts~n",[Cmd, Res]),
 1753:     Res.
 1754: 
 1755: disc_free(Path) ->
 1756:     Data = disksup:get_disk_data(),
 1757: 
 1758:     %% What partitions could Data be mounted on?
 1759:     Partitions =
 1760:         [D || {P, _Tot, _Perc}=D <- Data,
 1761:          lists:prefix(filename:nativename(P), filename:nativename(Path))],
 1762: 
 1763:     %% Sorting in descending order places the partition with the most specific
 1764:     %% path first.
 1765:     case lists:sort(fun erlang:'>='/2, Partitions) of
 1766:         [{_,Tot, Perc} | _] -> round(Tot * (1-(Perc/100)));
 1767:         [] -> error
 1768:     end.
 1769: 
 1770: memsize() ->
 1771:     case proplists:get_value(available_memory, memsup:get_system_memory_data()) of
 1772:         undefined ->
 1773:             {Tot,_Used,_}  = memsup:get_memory_data(),
 1774:             Tot;
 1775:         Available ->
 1776:             Available
 1777:     end.
